data: Create eye-catching content with no fuss. (Like this.)
See updates live as you save.
Use any emoji you want for your website's icon.
Display dates, lists, nested properties, links, and images in your frontmatter.
Write one line to list your blog posts.
Structure your content with smart nav menus.
Create rich links with titles and images.
Deliver your content to RSS readers with an Atom feed.
Submit your website to search engines with a sitemap that lists all of your pages.
Load pages quickly with plain HTML.
Go beyond tags to create authors and categories.

Any files prefixed with a period will be ignored, as will any files that are not markdown.
Every folder should have a settings.md file with one property:
At the root of the project, there should be a global settings file with the
property and any of the following properties:
: Full root URL for the website domain (e.g.
: Website author credit for RSS and copyright
: An emoji to use as the site favicon
You can put images in the assets folder, but this is discouraged, as it could result in a large bandwidth bill from your hosting provider.
You can put images in the
folder, but this is discouraged, as it could result in a large bandwidth bill from your hosting provider.
Images hosted on imgix will automatically be optimized, compressed, and formatted.
With Vowel, you can create reusable pieces of content and embed them throughout your website.
To create one, prefix a file or folder with a
. The file or folder will not produce a page, but the content can be displayed on other pages, like so:

This also allows richer content, as the item will be displayed with frontmatter.
The body element on each page has a class representing the current page. The homepage has classes "page home", while a blog post might have "page blog
element on each page has a class representing the current page. The homepage has classes
, while a blog post might have
Vowel attempts to construct a logical semantic HTML structure based on the files and folders in your website.
To do this, Vowel distinguishes between evergreen pages and ephemeral pages. A page with a
property is considered ephemeral, so it is excluded from the navigation and sitemap.
Vowel will automatically create a multi-level nav, with one level for each parent folder for the current page.
Vowel will create a full side navigation that displays all evergreen pages.
Vowel will attempt to impute the type of each frontmatter property. Imputed types include:
Date (will render a pretty date in a
You can also use lists and objects in frontmatter.

npx is the easiest way to use vowel:
Vowel will attempt to generate a website based on the contents of your file.
Create a directory. Then, open that directory and run these commands in your terminal:
npm init --y && npm i vowel svelte@next
and enter some basic information in the frontmatter:
See the quickstart for instructions on how to use npm.
for instructions on how to use npm.
npx -p svelte@next -p vowel@latest npx vowel build
We recommend deploying on Vercel. Run
to deploy your project. Ignore all of the build settings (except project title), as your project will include a
file for your styling. We recommend using a style framework like Pico or Open Props. You can simply download their stylesheet and either copy-paste it into your own or include it in
Beware: This project is still in development, so the generated markup is likely to change quickly and without warning, which will break your CSS. You might want to pin your version.
If the key for a frontmatter property matches a folder at the root of your project, Vowel will attempt to treat it as a taxonomy and link to the respe
If the key for a frontmatter property matches a folder at the root of your project, Vowel will attempt to treat it as a taxonomy and link to the respective page.
For instance, in this folder structure:

This allows you to create author pages, category pages.
Vowel is a very simple Markdown- and CSS-based website generator.
into a directory of markdown files and run:
command forces the Svelte 5 peer depedency, without which the app will throw an error.)
Vowel is a minimal website framework for developers who love to write CSS and read RSS.
Vowel will generate a feature-rich HTML website from a directory of markdown files. The output is plain HTML. You can style it however you want with your own CSS.
This demo might not work due conflicts in Svelte 5's peer dependencies.)
Vowel is created by Sam Littlefair. If you have questions or comments,
reach out to me on Twitter
This project is still in early development. There are many bugs and the API is changing quickly.
[x] Add all element types supported in Obsidian to markdown
[x] Make taxonomies linkable in frontmatter (if a corresponding folder exists)
[ ] Make file names kebab-cased for URLs and links
[x] Figure out how to stop components from remounting on every change
[x] Demote headings global option (headings are now demoted intelligently)
